org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.model

Class Itinerary

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.Visualizable
      • org.drools.planner.examples.ras2012.model.Itinerary

  • public final class Itinerary
extends Visualizable
    Represents the way a Train travels the Route, including all the stops for MaintenanceWindows and WaitTimes. It is basically a schedule for the train on the Territory. Instances of the class cache most of their data, only updating it when a WaitTime change occurs. (See setWaitTime(Node, WaitTime) and removeWaitTime(Node).) This class has no concept of planning horizon. It always calculates the whole schedule, from the train entry to train reaching destination.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Itinerary(Route r, Train t)
      Create schedule for a given Train, travelling a given Route, experiencing no MaintenanceWindow s.
      Itinerary(Route r, Train t, Collection<MaintenanceWindow> maintenanceWindows)
      Create schedule for a given Train, travelling a given Route, possibly experiencing some MaintenanceWindows.
